com.facebook.collections

Interface SimpleHeap<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type being held. Implementations will require that T extend Comparable or provide a Comparator
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LongTupleHeap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLongTupleList, LongPairList, LongTripleList, PriorityQueueHeap

    public interface SimpleHeap<T>
extends Iterable<T>

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(T item)
      adds an item to the heap.
      boolean addAll(Collection<? extends T> items)
      adds a collection of items to the head of the heap
      SimpleHeap<T> makeCopy()
      makes a copy of the heap.
      T peek()
      does not alter the heap, read-only method
      T poll()
      removes the top of the heap
      int shrink()
      optional method, may be a no-op if implemented, shrinks the heap's memory footprint as much as possible
      int size() 

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        iterator

    • Method Detail

      • peek

        T peek()
        does not alter the heap, read-only method
        Returns:
        the top of the heap, or least according to comparison order; null if empty heap

      • poll

        T poll()
        removes the top of the heap
        Returns:
        the top of the heap, or least according to comparison order; null if empty heap

      • add

        boolean add(T item)
        adds an item to the heap.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        true iff only added (ex: heap impls may be bounded)

      • addAll

        boolean addAll(Collection<? extends T> items)
        adds a collection of items to the head of the heap
        Parameters:
        items -
        Returns:
        true iff at least one item was added

      • size

        int size()
        Returns:
        number of elements in the heap

      • shrink

        int shrink()
        optional method, may be a no-op if implemented, shrinks the heap's memory footprint as much as possible
        Returns:
        may return the # of slots or bytes saved. A return value of 0 need not indicate 0 saved, per see. See implementation's documentation

      • makeCopy

        SimpleHeap<T> makeCopy()
        makes a copy of the heap. May be faster than iterating and calling add() or addAll()
        Returns:
        copy of the heap.
